subclusters.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction and Cellular Senescence Theory

theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on accumulation and mosaic distribution of mtDNA deletions causing mitochondrial dysfunction and aging.
Describes ovarian aging driven by accumulation of large-scale mtDNA deletions impairing mitochondrial function.
Details tissue-specific accumulation of somatic mtDNA deletions contributing to aging-related functional decline.
Explains progressive accumulation of multiple independent mtDNA deletions with age affecting mitochondrial function.
Focuses on age-related accumulation of specific mtDNA deletions impairing neuronal energy production in aging and Alzheimer’s.
Links mitochondrial topoisomerase dysfunction to mtDNA attrition and respiratory chain defects contributing to aging.
Describes mtDNA heteroplasmy dynamics and inheritance affecting mitochondrial genome variability and aging.
Focuses on somatic accumulation of mtDNA point mutations in tRNA genes impairing mitochondrial protein synthesis and aging.
Describes clonal expansion of mtDNA point mutations causing respiratory chain deficiency and stem cell dysfunction.
Explains mtDNA mutation accumulation in hematopoietic stem cells causing premature aging phenotypes distinct from physiological aging.
Proposes mtDNA base composition influences genome stability and species lifespan, linking mtDNA mutability to aging.
Describes thioretinaco complex role in oxidative phosphorylation and mitochondrial ATP synthesis mechanism.
Details age-related decline in oxidative phosphorylation capacity and ANT modification impairing ATP production.
Focuses on complex III QO site defect increasing ROS production and oxidative damage in aging heart mitochondria.
Proposes kinase-linked mild depolarization of mitochondrial membrane potential modulates ROS and mitochondrial aging.
Explores caloric restriction effects on mitochondrial ROS, biogenesis, and protein deacetylation impacting mitochondrial function.
Describes impaired AMPK-NAD+-PGC1α-SIRT1 signaling pathway reducing mitochondrial turnover and function during aging.
Links mitochondrial efficiency in oxidative phosphorylation to intelligence, health, and aging mechanisms.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial redox impairment, endosymbiotic crosstalk deterioration, and mitochondrial role in cellular senescence and SASP.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitochondrial chaperone mortalin dysfunction leading to mitochondrial impairment and neuronal cellular senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links mitochondrial dysfunction to impaired Fe-S cluster biogenesis causing nuclear genomic instability and aging-related cellular decline.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Explains mitochondrial hyperfission and dynamics imbalance causing vascular mitochondrial dysfunction and aging-related microvascular disease.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes mitochondria integrate psychosocial stress into cellular aging via mitochondrial allostatic load and systemic signaling.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitochondrial defects influencing nuclear silencing and lifespan extension pathways linking mitochondria to aging regulation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial-nuclear genome interaction dysregulation after sexual reproduction disrupting mitochondrial function and aging.
